qas.question: Since when has the severe weather in the Alps been studied?
Particularly what part of the weather has been studied?
What was placed in the mountains early in the 20th century?
Where is the Aosta valley located?

context: The severe weather in the Alps has been studied since <a0_0>the 18th century<a0_0/>; particularly <a1_0>the weather patterns<a1_0/> such as the seasonal foehn wind. <a2_0>Numerous weather stations<a2_0/> were placed in the mountains early in the early 20th century, providing continuous data for climatologists. Some of the valleys are quite arid such as the Aosta valley in <a3_0>Italy<a3_0/>, the Maurienne in France, the Valais in <a4_0>Switzerland<a4_0/>, and northern Tyrol.
